intro: Physematium angolense, commonly known as the Angolan starling plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and they bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Physematium angolense is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
